article:
An 'arcade game' (or 'coin-op') is a coin-operated entertainment machine,
usually installed in public businesses, such as restaurants, bars, and
particularly amusement arcades. Most arcade games are video games, pinball
machines, electro-mechanical games, redemption games, and merchandisers (such as
claw cranes).

The golden age of arcade video games lasted from the late 1970s  to the mid-1990s . While arcade games were still relatively
popular during the late 1990s , the entertainment medium saw a
continuous decline in popularity in the Western hemisphere when home-based video
game consoles made the transition from 2D graphics to 3D graphics. Despite this,
arcades remain popular in many parts of Asia as late as the early 2010s.

The term "arcade game" is also, in recent times, used to refer to a video
game that was designed to play similarly to an arcade game with frantic,
addicting gameplay.
headings: List of highest-grossing arcade video games
